comments.name: MATERIAL
comments.text:
As far as visible during the inspection areas of the structure include:
Typical wood framing

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all exterior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Recommend caulking/sealing all wall penetrations and any intersections between building materials.
Significant cracks were noted at the front and right side of the house. 
Possible stucco leak noted in the front right bedroom.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior trim:
Caulking recommended at intersections between dissimilar building materials.
Peeling paint in several areas. Recommend sanding and repainting.
Moisture damaged shutters on the front of the house. 
Chipped EIFS trim at the main entrance way.
Moisture damaged ends of the fascia at the front of the house. Repair/replace as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Slab is not fully visible.
The following concerns were noted at the slab:
Cracks in slab noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age.Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Cracked noted at the footing at the front left of the house. 
Typical corner cracking noted.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair as needed.
Unable to fully view and inspect the slab on the left side of the house due to landscaping and personal belongings. 
Monitor for problems and repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the landscaping:
Trim plants away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.
Wood to ground contact noted where the fence meets the house. Recommend eliminating all wood to soil contact.
Trees are touching/overhanging the roof.  Damage is possible. Trim plants and trees away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.

comments.name: SITE
comments.text:
Grade at foundation appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with grading:
Evidence of poor drainage near the slab at all sides of the house. 
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair/correct.

Appears serviceable

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text:

Same as structure, open design

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Normal signs of weathering and aging noted. Regular maintenance recommended.

comments.name: ROOF ACCESS
comments.text: Walked on roof. Unable to fully access due to pitch.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable with signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.
The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Roof mounted equipment noted.  As fasteners inserted through the roof surface increase the possibility for leakage this area must be regularly maintained and inspected.
Organic growth noted on the shingles. Recommend soft washing.
Damaged shingles at the front left corner of the house due to landscaping.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair as needed.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text: None.  Consider installing gutters and downspouts to help with site drainage

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text: Main line is 3/4 inch diameter , Polyethylene

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Main water shut off valve is located In the front right bedroom closet

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable, valve not tested, water pressure appears adequate.

comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Plumbing vents appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the waste lines:
Open waste line/broken cap at the rear right of the slab. 
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair or replace.

Recommend installing.

Appears serviceableThe following concerns were noted with the slab/floor:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Restricted access due to personal belongings. Unable to fully inspect. Perform a thorough inspection prior to closing after personal items have been removed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Automatic door opener(s)- operational
Electric eye automatic reverse feature is operational
Pressure sensitive safety reverse feature was not tested as part of this inspection due to the risk of damage to the garage door in the event of an inoperable/not installed pressure sensitive device.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the walls/ceiling:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all interior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Nails popping noted, Non-professional repairs noted, Repair as needed.
Restricted access due to personal belongings. Unable to fully inspect. Perform a thorough inspection prior to closing after personal items have been removed.

comments.name: MAIN ENTRY DOOR
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems. Recommend regular caulking/painting/maintenance
The following concerns were noted at the main entry door:
Gap noted between the movable and stationary door. 
Pet damage/minor damage and worn covering is noted. 
Doorbell does not function properly.
Repair/replace as needed.

comments.name: OTHER EXTERIOR DOORS
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

Pet damage and peeling covering is noted at the door and trim.
Repair/replace as needed.

comments.name: INTERIOR DOORS
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior doors:
The master bedroom door doesn't latch.
Recommend adjustment.
Minor damage and peeling paint is noted at the trim and doors.
repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the windows:
Low-E failure noted at the master bedroom rear right window and left hall bathroom window.
Repair/replace as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior walls:
Typical cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all interior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Nails popping noted, Non-professional repairs noted, Repair as needed.
Swollen/moisture damaged baseboards in the dining area. No high moisture readings noted. 
Bulking/moisture damaged baseboard under the window in the front right bedroom. 
High moisture reading at time of the inspection. 
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION

Typical cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all interior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

High moisture reading at time of the inspection. 
Leakage is noted around the right dormer window.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replace.

Worn covering, chipped, and peeling covering at the wood flooring

Repair/replace as needed.

comments.text:

High-loop is present on drain line- Proper installation

Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

The following concerns were noted at the disposal:
Unit is noisy during operation.
Rusting noted at interior impeller blades.
Replace as needed.

comments.name: WATER AND WASTE CONDITION
comments.text: No washing machine installed. Laundry plumbing was not tested. Inspector is not allowed to operate valves. We Highly recommend verifying proper operation of plumbing before close of transaction.

comments.name: ELECTRICAL AND GAS CONDITION
comments.text:
240V Service-operational and the electrical outlet is grounded
4 prong outlet provide
Gas service is capped

Dryer venting is provided

Recommend sealing around the vent flashing at the exterior wall.

Laundry sink is provided

comments.name: EVAPORATOR CONDENSATE LINE AND/PAN
comments.text:
Condensate line installed.
Float switch noted/not tested

comments.name: HEATING FUEL TYPE
comments.text: Natural Gas. (The heat exchanger portion of a gas or oil fired heater is difficult to access without disassembly and cannot be adequately checked during a visual inspection.  We recommend a service contract be placed on the unit and a heating contractor called to verify the condition of the heat exchanger prior to settlement date.)

comments.name: AIR FILTERS
comments.text:
Appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at air filter:
Suggest changing filter

comments.name: CONDITIONS
comments.text:
Ran camera to city and back under slab from the front right clean out. Also ran camera from rear right clean out to view master bath branch line.  Pipe appeared to be in good condition with good functional flow at visible portions.  

The following concerns were noted:  Minor belly and debris build up observed at approximately 35-40ft  and around 65ft from the front right clean out headed towards the city drop.  Bellies did not appear to alter functional flow.  Monitor for problems.
Cracked clean outs/pipe ends observed at both the buried city clean out at the front right of property and at the rear right slab clean out.  Recommend having a qualified plumber repair/replace.  

Click here to view your sewer scope video. 
https://youtu.be/EnpRl-Clr58

comments.name: WEATHER
comments.text: Rain.  Please note that rain during the home inspection may limit safe access to some areas (i.e. walking on the roof).  If there are any concerns about any areas where inspection may have been limited, a follow up inspection is recommended prior to closing

comments.name: ADDITIONAL COMMENTS
comments.text: The steamer is not tested as part of the home inspection.
